column4: hi, I am new here, I need help on devekoping gnome apps in ubuntu
I am building myself. i installed all packages but when comiling under gcc header files are not found
it is already installed but it is not working
see if this yields any files 'sudo apt-get build-dep gcc'
about my gnome dev problem: none of the proposed solutions have worked! gnome.h still cannot be found by gcc
but I installed all gnome development packages
here are the standard C libraries: stdio.h, ctype.h, string.h, math.h, stdlib.h, assert.h, stdarg.h, setjmp.h, signal.h, time.h, limits.h and float.h
I realize that. But even after installing the gnome development packages, the gnome header file cannot be found. should I pass any arguments to gcc when compiling
I also installed libgnome-dev which is supposed to install all libraries for me
to specify a non-standard library location myahya_ use the -L {DIRNAME} or -I {DIRNAME}
I can't find gnome.h using locate
